title: Project-Based Language Education Course for Integrating Digital Media and Sustainability

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital tools and intermediate or higher language proficiency
context.additional_context: Language project implementation considering the ecological, economic, and social sustainability of digital media based on the TPACK model

learning_goals: Learners can design sustainability-themed language projects using digital media tools (virtual field trips, smartboards, LLMs)
Learners propose integrated technology-content-pedagogy strategies for sustainable digital media use based on the TPACK model

Learners analyze three types of digital media-based language learning materials using a sustainability evaluation rubric across ecological (energy efficiency), economic (cost-effectiveness), and social (cultural diversity) dimensions, and create a suitability judgment report meeting ≥3 points (60%) on a 5-point scale rubric for each material.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
